title: How do moral characters develop ethics? - Quora

response.answer_text: I love ethics as an abstract concept, sort of like astronomy or evolution. But, like astronomy and evolution, ethics have very little impact or effect on human behavior. That’s because there are few rewards for ethical behavior and many, many rewards for unethical behavior. For example, I used to teach at a large university. My dean (my boss’s boss) told us that he expected about 15% of our students to get A’s and about 15% to get F’s. It didn’t matter if I had a class of dimwits or a class of geniuses, the distribution of grades should look pretty much like the normal curve. So, when assigning grades, did I follow my ethical beliefs or my dean’s instructions? Candidly, I liked my paycheck much more than I liked my students. All corporate employees surely understand what I’m saying.
